title: Blue Velvet reunion: Laura Dern, Isabella Rossellini and Kyle MacLachlan pose
text:
They starred together in the 1986 film Blue Velvet from director David Lynch.

And on Sunday evening the three main stars of the critically acclaimed film - Laura Dern, Isabella Rossellini and Kyle MacLachlan - all got together for a mini reunion.

They were seen arm-in-arm at the 11th Annual Governors Awards gala hosted by the Academy Of Motion Picture Arts And Sciences on Sunday.

Trio: They starred together in the 1986 film Blue Velvet from director David Lynch. And on Sunday evening the three main stars of the critically acclaimed film - Laura Dern, Isabella Rossellini and Kyle MacLachlan - all got together for a mini reunion

Back together again: They were seen arm-in-arm at the 11th Annual Governors Awards gala hosted by the Academy Of Motion Picture Arts And Sciences on Sunday

The movie made waves when it was released as it depicted a twisted, amoral world.

The film centered on college student Jeffrey Beaumont (MacLachlan) who returns home after his father has a stroke.

According to the synopsis on IMDB: 'When he discovers a severed ear in an abandoned field, Beaumont teams up with detective's daughter Sandy Williams (Dern) to solve the mystery. They believe beautiful lounge singer Dorothy Vallens (Isabella Rossellini) may be connected with the case, and Beaumont finds himself becoming drawn into her dark, twisted world, where he encounters sexually depraved psychopath Frank Booth (Dennis Hopper).'

Real to reel: Dern played detective's daughter Sandy Williams in the classic movie

He was the star: Kyle played college student Jeffrey Beaumont in the 1986 film

Dern wore her hair in curls as she modeled a form-fitting black suit.

She is best known for her current hit, Big Little Lies 2.

Isabella, the daughter of acting icon Ingrid Bergman - who died in 1982 - looked thrilled to be there.

The 67-year-old dazzled in a magenta silk gown.

Kyle was dapper in a black suit. The 60-year-old is best known for the films Dune and the series Twin Peaks.

Drama: The film centered on college student Jeffrey Beaumont (MacLachlan) who returns home after his father has a stroke. Seen with Isabella

Still close pals: Laura and Kyle held hands as they walked out on stage

All there for Lynch: They were helping David collect his award; also seen here is Isabella

Surreal: The star, 73, has been making films for five decades. Lynch says that his work is more similar in many respects to that of European filmmakers than American ones. He is best known for the acclaimed films such as Eraserhead, Wild At Heart, Lost Highway and Mulholland Drive

The Blue Velvet cast was at the event to present an award to David.

Lynch was dressed in a black tie and suit for the big honor.

The star, 73, has been making films for five decades. Lynch says that his work is more similar in many respects to that of European filmmakers than American ones.

He is best known for the acclaimed films such as Eraserhead, Wild At Heart, Lost Highway and Mulholland Drive.

Born to a middle-class family in Missoula, Montana, Lynch spent his childhood traveling around the United States before he studied painting at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia.

Lynch founded the David Lynch Foundation in 2005, which sought to fund the teaching of TM in schools.

Also at the event was Jennifer Lopez who stood out in a chartreuse gown.

Charlize Theron went with a black top and white skirt with a black clutch.

Scarlett Johnasson was daring in a gold top with black skirt that had a long slit.

The leading ladies were dressed to impress, opting for simple and seductive looks for the star-studded festivities.

Jennifer donned a silky strapless Reem Acra gown, the citron shade suiting her to perfection.

The Hustlers actress' dress billowed down from her bust, flowing to the floor with an A-line silhouette. Turning around to show off her angles, she revealed a satin bow at the back.

Jennifer drew attention to her decolletage with a stunned double layered diamond necklace and glimmering earrings. Rounding out the mother of two's accessories was a boxy onyx clutch.

She braided her hair up and away from her face while going for full glamour with a dramatic bronze makeup look.

She knows what she's doing: J-Lo gave a wink to the camera before walking off

Charlize embraced timeless style in a black and white Tom Ford ensemble which teamed a simple tunic with a full creme skirt.

She carried a small purse and added a bit of sparkle with diamond earrings.

She went for a natural beauty look by playing up her already stunning features with a hint of bronzer and nude lips.

All the white, the Bombshell actress kept her cropped 'do styled sleekly.

Timeless: Charlize embraced timeless style in a black and white Tom Ford ensemble which teamed a simple tunic with a full creme skirt

Scarlett was elegant as ever while wearing an exquisite one-shouldered Celine gown in gold and black.

Although already glamorous, she dressed up the look with earrings, gold cuffs and metallic heels which perfectly matched her dress.

Ever detail was in order as the fiance of Colin Jost painted her face with a sultry cat-eye touched with gold glitter. Letting her bold makeup look take center-stage, the actress smoothed her hair into a center part to style it back sleekly

A bit of skin: Scarlett's chicness couldn't be denied as she stepped onto the red carpet in the flank-flaunting gold and black Celine look

Matchy matchy: Although already glamorous, she dressed up the look with earrings, gold cuffs and metallic heels which perfectly matched her dress

Dakota Johnson looked absolutely angelic in a two-piece Brandon Maxwell ensemble.

The celebrity spawn of Melanie Griffith and Don Johnson put her fabulous figure front and center in a pleated top and matching skirt. The Fifty Shades Of Grey star added triangular earrings into the mix.

Her hair cascaded down in soft waves all while she donned dramatic burgundy lips and smoky plum shadow.

All made up: The Fifty Shades Of Grey star's hair cascaded down in soft waves all while she donned dramatic burgundy lips and smoky plum shadow

Olivia Wilde sizzled in a plunging ruby sequins from Ralph Lauren. Her dramatic dress dipped low to show off maximum amounts of skin before cinching together around the waist and transitioning into a streamlined skirt.

Olivia styled her caramel tresses in beach waves. Her makeup consisted of shimmering eyeshadow and a nude lip.

Lupita Nyong'o's fashion taste flourished in a botanically-inspired Givenchy design with a high neckline. She teamed the look with short, blunt fringe, berry lips and a touch of teal eyeliner.

Buddies: Wilde, the longtime partner of Jason Sudeikis, got chummy with Jon Hamm at the awards

Saoirse Ronan looked bold in a checkered Emilia Wickstead jumpsuit with full sleeves and wide-legged trousers.

She braided gold thread through her hair, which was laid across her head like a tiara. Saoirse added a playful twist with a pink lip and silver glitter across her eyelids.

Renee Zellweger was sophisticated in a black dress with a Bardot neckline and glimmering embellishments. Renee, who is earning rave reviews for her depiction of Judy Garland, went for old school elegance as she pinned her hair to one side and went with an understated makeup look.
